IRS990.MissionDesc: CAPITOL HILL DAY SCHOOL IS A CO-EDUCATIONAL INDEPENDENT SCHOOL SERVING STUDENTS FROM PRE-KINDERGARTEN THROUGH 8TH GRADE. CAPITOL HILL DAY SCHOOL DEEPLY ENGAGES A DIVERSE COMMUNITY OF STUDENTS IN CONNECTING THE CLASSROOM WITH THE LARGER WORLD, SUPPORTING EACH CHILD IN DEVELOPING CONFIDENCE, COMPASSION, AND INTELLECTUAL CAPACITY TO LIVE A LIFE OF PURPOSE AND VALUE.
IRS990.Desc: CAPITOL HILL DAY SCHOOL IS AN INDEPENDENT, CO-EDUCATIONAL SCHOOL FOR STUDENTS IN PRE-KINDERGARTEN THROUGH EIGHTH GRADE. TOGETHER, ITS ACADEMIC DAY PROGRAM AND AUXILIARY PROGRAMS IN THE LATE AFTERNOON AND SUMMER REFLECT THE SCHOOL'S COMMITMENT TO CREATE A COMMUNITY OF STUDENTS FROM VARYING BACKGROUNDS IN WHICH INDIVIDUAL DIFFERENCES ARE RESPECTED AND VALUED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: TEACHERS' ENDOWMENT: SUPPORT TEACHER DEVELOPMENT. EDUCATIONAL ENDOWMENT: SUPPORT CURRICULUM. FINANCIAL AID ENDOWMENT: PROVIDE EXCEPTIONAL FINANCIAL AID ASSISTANCE.

FOR THE YEARS ENDED JUNE 30, 2018 AND 2017, THE SCHOOL HAS DOCUMENTED ITS CONSIDERATION OF FASB ASC 740-10, INCOME TAXES, THAT PROVIDES GUIDANCE FOR REPORTING UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES AND HAS DETERMINED THAT NO MATERIAL UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS QUALIFY FOR EITHER RECOGNITION OR DISCLOSURE IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
FUNDRAISING EVENT EXPENSES REPORTED AS EXPENSE ON THE 45,596. FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND NETTED AGAINST REVENUE ON FORM 990 PART VIII, LINE 8B.

FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE NETTED AGAINST REVENUE ON THE 958,749. FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND REPORTED AS TUITION ASSISTANCE EXPENSE AND BENEFITS ON FORM 990, PART IX. LOSS ON DISPOSAL OF ASSETS REPORTED AS AN EXPENSE ON THE -1,491. FINANICAL STATEMENTS AND NETTED AGAINST REVENUE ON FORM 990, PART VIII, LINE 7C.
FUNDRAISING EVENT EXPENSES REPORTED AS EXPENSE ON THE 45,596. FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND NETTED AGAINST REVENUE ON FORM 990 PART VIII, LINE 8B.

FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE NETTED AGAINST REVENUE ON THE 958,749. FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND REPORTED AS TUITION ASSISTANCE EXPENSE AND BENEFITS ON FORM 990, PART IX. LOSS ON DISPOSAL OF ASSETS REPORTED ON FINANICAL STATEMENTS -1,491. FINANICAL STATEMENTS AND NETTED AGAINST REVENUE ON FORM 990, PART VIII, LINE 7C.
PUBLISHED IN THE WASHINGTON POST ON FRIDAY, NOVEMBER 24TH, 2017 IN THE METRO SECTION, PAGE B3.
CAPITOL HILL DAY SCHOOL PROVIDES FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO APPROVED ELIGIBLE FAMILIES.
R. JASON GRAY AND DANIELLE M. BOWEN EACH RECEIVED A BONUS OF $101.

TaxExemptBondsIssuesGrp.PurposeDesc: FINANCE, REFINANCE AND REIMBURSE COSTS TO RENOVATE, FURNISH & EQUIP SCHOOL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ISSUER NAME: DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA DATE THE REBATE COMPUTATION WAS PERFORMED: 09/06/2013

ACTUAL PROJECT COSTS WERE LESS THAN THE TOTAL PROCEEDS OF THE BONDS. AS A RESULT, EXCESS PROCEEDS (PLUS CERTAIN ADDITIONAL MONIES) WERE USED TO RETIRE PRINCIPAL AND INTEREST ON THE BONDS. EXCESS PROCEEDS USED TO RETIRE PRINCIPAL AND INTEREST IN 2013 TOTALED $383,492.
THE REBATE COMPUTATION WAS CALCULATED ON JULY 21, 2014.
THIS COLUMN INCLUDES THE NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTIONS RECEIVED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EACH PARENT OF A CHILD ENROLLED IN THE SCHOOL IS A MEMBER OF THE ORGANIZATION. A PARENT CEASES TO BE A MEMBER WHEN HE OR SHE HAS NO CHILDREN ENROLLED IN THE SCHOOL. EACH EMPLOYEE, MEMBER OF THE FACULTY, OR ADMINISTRATIVE STAFF OF THE SCHOOL, WHO IS NOT OTHERWISE A MEMBER, IS A MEMBER OF THE ORGANIZATION. AN EMPLOYEE CEASES TO BE A MEMBER WHEN HIS OR HER EMPLOYMENT IS TERMINATED. EACH TRUSTEE, WHO IS NOT OTHERWISE A MEMBER, IS A MEMBER OF THE ORGANIZATION. A TRUSTEE CEASES TO BE A MEMBER WHEN HIS OR HER TRUSTEESHIP IS TERMINATED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CHDS MEMBERSHIP RIGHTS INCLUDE: A. MEMBERS ELECT THE MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES B. MEMBERS MAY PETITION THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES FOR A MEETING OF THE ORGANIZATION FOLLOWING SUBMISSION OF A PETITION FROM 20% OF THE MEMBERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCE & OPERATIONS PREPARED THE INFORMATION REQUIRED TO COMPLETE THE 990 AND SUBMITTED IT TO THE OUTSIDE ACCOUNTANTS WHO THEN PREPARED THE 990 FOR REVIEW BY THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCE & OPERATIONS. CHDS THEN DISTRIBUTED THE FORM 990 TO THE BOARD MEMBERS ELECTRONICALLY FOR REVIEW AND COMMENT BEFORE IT WAS FILED WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CONFLICTS OF INTEREST POLICY REQUIRES FULL DISCLOSURE BY TRUSTEES OF ALL ACTUAL AND POTENTIAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST. EACH TRUSTEE OF THE BOARD, OFFICER, AND KEY EMPLOYEE OF THE SCHOOL ANNUALLY DISCLOSES ANY AND ALL FACTS THAT MAY BE CONSTRUED AS A CONFLICT OF INTEREST, AND, WHENEVER SUCH ACTUAL OR POTENTIAL CONFLICT EXISTS, BEFORE ANY RELEVANT BOARD OR COMMITTEE ACTION. THE AUDIT COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD REVIEWS DISCLOSURES AND DETERMINES WHETHER OR NOT A CONFLICT OF INTEREST EXISTS AND WHETHER OR NOT SUCH CONFLICT MATERIALLY AND ADVERSELY AFFECTS THE INTEREST OF THE SCHOOL. THE TRUESTEE WHOSE POTENTIAL CONFLICT IS UNDER REVIEW MAY NOT DEBATE, VOTE, OR OTHERWISE PARTICIPATE IN SUCH DETERMINATION. IF THE AUDIT COMMITTEE DETERMINES THAT AN ACTUAL OR POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST DOES EXIST, THE BOARD ALSO DETERMINES AN APPROPRIATE REMEDY PURSUANT TO THE PROCESS SET FORTH IN THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST COMPLIANCE AND RESOLUTION PROCEDURES. SUCH A REMEDY MAY INCLUDE THE RECUSAL OF THE CONFLICTED TRUSTEE FROM CERTAIN MATTERS PENDING BEFORE THE BOARD. THE SAME CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY APPLIES TO EMPLOYEES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: SALARIES ARE SET IN ACCORDANCE WITH POLICY ESTABLISHED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES USING COMPENSATION SURVEY DATA PROVIDED BY THE ASSOCIATION OF INDEPENDENT SCHOOLS OF GREATER WASHINGTON (AISGW), THE NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF INDEPENDENT SCHOOLS (NAIS), AND THE ASSOCIATION OF INDEPENDENT MARYLAND SCHOOLS (AIMS). THE SALARY IS INCORPORATED INTO A WRITTEN CONTRACT SIGNED BY BOTH PARTIES. THE LAST SALARY REVIEW WAS COMPLETED IN JUNE 2018.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE FROM THE SCHOOL UPON REQUEST. THE HEAD OF SCHOOL EVALUATES EACH REQUEST SEPARATELY AND, WHERE APPROPRIATE, PROVIDES THOSE DOCUMENTS TO THE REQUESTOR.
GAIN ON INTEREST RATE SWAP OBLIGATION 43,813.
